title: BBC Breakfast's Carol Kirkwood reveals the secret way she has been shedding the pounds
text:
TV BBC Breakfast's Carol Kirkwood reveals the secret way she has been shedding the pounds The BBC presenter works on both TV and radio in the mornings and has to sprint back and forth from the studios Share Weather girl Carol Kirkwood is on air every 15 minutes and has to race back and forth from TV to radio (Photo: FameFlynet UK Tel : +44 (0)20 3551 5049 Email : info@fameflynet.uk.com) Share Get celebs   Thank you for subscribing!   
BBC Breakfast weather presenter Carol Kirkwood is shedding the pounds by running – and is even sprinting between her stints on the air. 
She works on both TV and radio in the mornings and runs in trainers from studio to studio to burn off the calories. 
Carol, 54, said: “I always say my hips look fat or my bottom looks huge. 
“I was never a runner but last year the BBC asked me to do a 5k challenge. 
“I didn’t think I could run, for obvious reasons,” she says, pointing to her boobs. 
She adds: “I started doing it because it was for the BBC’s Get Inspired campaign. They wanted me to inspire others, so I couldn’t give up.” 
Carol now loves it and has moved up to 10k runs. Read More BBC Breakfast’s Dan Walker blasts Piers Morgan after calling weather girl Carol Kirkwood 'universally reviled' Carol Kirkwood says she probably does 8,000 steps a day (Photo: Manchester Evening News) 
She says: “I’m so busy during my shift I have trainers on. I run from the TV studio to radio because I am on every 15 minutes. I’ve got a good pair of trainers! I think I do about six to eight thousand steps every morning.” 
Weather presenter Carol however became embroiled in a TV storm of her own last week after a row broke out between her co-star Dan Walker and Good Morning Britain's Piers Morgan . 
Carol scooped the gong for Best Weather Presenter at the Television and Radio Industries Club Awards last week but the decision didn't go down well with Piers Morgan. Read More Queasy BBC weatherman leaves fans fearing for his health after abruptly disappearing BEFORE finishing forecast Carol, however, says it is doing wonders for her figure (Photo: PA) 
During Wednesday's live show of Good Morning Britain, Piers Morgan hit out at Carol , claiming the award went to "somebody from a rival show that nobody watches". 
He then added: "The winner was someone that is universally reviled around the world isn't she?" 
While his co-host Susanna Reid attempted to diffuse the situation by saying "that's not strictly true", his comments weren't missed by Carol's co-star Dan. 
Writing on Twitter, he raged: "Oi @piersmorgan... I don't mind you lying about your viewing figures but lay off @carolkirkwood. She is queen. You are 1 of her subjects." Like us on Facebook
